summary: In this context, ammonia (NH3) is mentioned as one of the gas-phase markers measured during the study of exposure to constituents from an electrically heated cigarette smoking system (EHCSS). It is categorized alongside other volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and total volatile organic compounds (TVOC), indicating its relevance as an organic chemical in the assessment of environmental tobacco smoke (ETS) exposure. However, the specific interactions or implications of ammonia as an organic chemical are not elaborated upon in detail.
